1.title: A Doctrine for Today
1.plot: The doctrine of justification by faith alone is essential to our understanding of the gospel itself. In the first part of this series, R.C. Sproul argues that justification by faith alone remains, to this day, a doctrine with eternal consequences.

2.title: Martin Luther
2.plot: Martin Luther's role in the Reformation cannot be overstated. In the second part of this series, R.C. Sproul explains how the life of Martin Luther is essential to the historical framework of the Reformation and its central importance for the doctrine of justification by faith alone.

3.title: The Ninety-Five Theses
3.plot: Martin Luther's rediscovery of the imputation of Christ's righteousness to the believer changed everything. In the third part of this series, R.C. Sproul explains how this discovery was a precursor to the Reformation.

4.title: The Roman Catholic View
4.plot: The best way to understand the Reformed view of justification is in comparison to the Roman Catholic view. In the fourth part of this series, R.C. Sproul reviews the Roman Catholic doctrine of justification as defined at the Council of Trent.

5.title: Defining Our Terms
5.plot: Defining terms is critical to understanding and communicating the Protestant position on justification. In the fifth part of this series, R.C. Sproul concludes our study of the Roman Catholic view and begins to define the terms in the phrase, "justification by faith alone."

6.title: By Faith Alone
6.plot: What are the essential elements of saving faith, and where should it be placed? In the sixth part of this series, R.C. Sproul continues to define the terms in the phrase justification by faith alone by taking a closer look at a saving faith that is in Christ alone.

7.title: Paul's Letter to the Romans
7.plot: Paul gives his most exhaustive treatment of the doctrine of justification by faith in his letter to the Romans. In the seventh part of this series, R.C. Sproul takes us through the most important passages of Romans and expands on the theological concepts contained within the doctrine of justification.

8.title: The Consequences of Justification
8.plot: Justification by faith gives us peace with, access to, and hope in a holy God. In the eighth part of this series, R.C. Sproul continues his study of justification in Paul's letter to the Romans by introducing the results of justification in the life of the believer.

9.title: Paul vs. James?
9.plot: Paul's epistle to the Romans is not irreconcilable with the epistle of James. In the ninth part of this series, R.C. Sproul explains how we are to understand two seemingly contradictory portions of Scripture that deal with the doctrine of justification.

10.title: Questions and Answers
10.plot: Having examined the doctrine of justification historically, theologically, and scripturally, R.C. Sproul concludes the final part of this study by answering questions that help underline the fact that justification is indeed by faith alone.

imdb.title: Justified by Faith Alone
plot: R.C. Sproul explores the doctrine of justification historically, theologically, and biblically, carefully defining each term in the phrase "justified by faith alone" while pointing to the imputation of a righteousness found only in Jesus.
